body.name: Iron: A Steamy Fantasy Romance (The Queen & The Assassin Book 1)

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #34,419 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #188 in Historical Fantasy (Kindle Store) #337 in Fairy Tale Fantasy (Kindle Store) #1,693 in Fantasy Romance eBooks

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: (check out how AWESOME this cover is!)This one was extremely addicting and amazing! The MCs Tamar and Runo were so ❤️⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Tamar is the Queen of Redwood. Her dead husand, the King, was extremely violent and physically abusive.. this story starts a few years after she poisons and kills him.Runo is an assassin in the employ of a rival empire. He visits the kingdom of Redwood on a paid assignment to kill Tamar.But then they meet, and have a deadly game of back and forth, and at each step, they fall for each other more. As new threats emerge and Runo and Tamar become closer and closer, it's only a matter of time before the enemies turn into lovers.⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐I loved their banter, their vulnerable conversations, their chemistry, and the ending was just ❤️ I really cannot wait for book 2! I'll just keep rereading the book 1 and it's ending till then :)))Also for those of you who have read her previous trilogy? There are a bunch of subtle mentions of Vivi and Jaghar in this book, and it was amazingg ❤️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This book was good! I liked that it was kind of a dual POV. I wish we had seen the queen be more of an iron queen. It was one of those we're told about it but don't see it. The chemistry between the leads was good. I would have liked a bit more world building but maybe that comes later in the series. 🌶🌶 on the spicy scale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I just happened upon this book and author from a Kindle Unlimited list. Well written, interesting characters, 🌶️🌶️ steam. I would’ve liked more world building, and honestly no book can ever go wrong with a map! Looking forward to reading more from this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic Main Characters
reviews.reviewText: Lisette Marshall is on my shortlist of go-to authors. Iron is my all-time favorite book featuring the assassin-to-lovers trope. I'm a huge fan of the trope and have devoured more of these than I could ever count. The main characters completely stole my heart. I instantly felt invested in their love story.Tamar, the beautiful Iron Queen always has to be hard and cold and ruthless and in control in order to maintain order. But under that hard exterior is a soft, caring heart and a love for the people her crown serves. Runo, the handsome, mischievous assassin, has a quick smile and a fun-loving spirit, and golden eyes that see more in one glance than they should be able to perceive. He is the first to see through her cold shell. Their romance burns hot quickly. This book has all the sexy steamy moments I've come to expect from a Marshall book.In addition to the blooming romance, strong heroine, and excellent banter, there's a mystery that needs to be solved. Who helped the sexy assassin get into the castle in the first place? Not even Runo knows. I thought I'd read enough Marshall books by now I'd be able to pick up on all the subtle clues, but once again she fooled me. I did not figure it out before the reveal.Have I mentioned yet that I'm completely in love with Runo? I don't care that he's a figment of someone's imagination. There were times while reading when I was so taken by his wit and smiles and inability to take anything (including death) seriously that I was ready to knife-fight Tamar for him :) I received an advanced copy of this book. I highly recommend it for fans of steamy fantasy romance in a medieval setting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Definitely slow burning but great intrigue and characters. Does feel a bit like jumping into a world with unexplained backstories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Elegant, absorbing, exquisite
reviews.reviewText: Push thru the abrupt and brash opening chapter- it may explain something later in the book but I haven't had an opening sequence quite as shocking before.Moving past that if you can, (I abandoned it until I forgot, weeks later, the start) the book is fast paced action filled and breathlessly dramatic.An assassin & the queen?The drama! The tension!It delighted.Megan Whalen Turner wrote it first and this is a spicier adult version, but it has the same longing permeating the prose.Disregarding some elements that I found incongruous & jarring (did the author have a quota to meet on bedroom acts?), the overall book is extremely romantic and delightfully nuanced.I'm almost afraid to move on to book 2 for fear of losing some of the delightful vibes this book leaves you with.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great series start
reviews.reviewText: Writing a good fantasy romance trilogy involving the same couple is not easy. While each book needs to have its own entertaining story arc, these arcs need to be interwoven with the three-book long character arcs of the main characters, all while delivering, if not a HEA (happily ever after), at least a HFN (happily for now) ending at the end of each book.Lisette delivers and does so while gifting us with two beautifully broken characters. The assassin, Runo, is everything you expect an assassin to be, yet it is the unexpected about him that makes him instantly likeable. Queen Tamar is the ultimate expression of a character who presents a strong face to the world, while hiding her true self. Their interactions, how they impact each other's growth is a joy to experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Enjoyable and quick read
reviews.reviewText: Overall, I liked this book. The character development was good and I appreciate the ways that both Tamar and Runo change by the end. Their romance is a bit cliche, but you kind of know what you're getting into when you buy a book about a queen and the assassin sent to kill her. There wasn't anything especially thrilling in the story, but the twist did surprise me, which is always a plus. This is a book where I'd probably read the next in the series eventually, but I'm not so eager that I'll start it right away. I'm happy with the ending as it is

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The writer has such a riveting way to weaving of tale that you can’t help but be sucked into her world ! Both Tamar and Runo are well developed characters with flaws and vulnerability yet a spine of steel .I had no Inkling how the story would unfold and I turned page with equal trepidation . It has intrigue, romance and twists . Though this book ends on a happy note , I really can’t get my head around as to how the next book in the trilogy will fare . And that’s what I love !

4,5⭐️Runo was tasked by his Taavi Empress and a third party to kill the Iron Queen of Redwood but he will found out that his task is more difficult than he thought.What an epic story !! I loved it !! Especially the fact that Runo doesn’t forget that his an assassin and he’s here to kill the Queen, despite the tension and the moment between the two he never forgets. Tamar is such an interesting character, and the playful side of Runo helps her to relax a little and forgot her Iron attitude. Such complementary characters, it’s awesome.The plot was well-rounded, and I cannot wait to know what will happen next with the Empress. Not always a fan of political drama but it’s so great and not boring 😉So definitely planning to read the rest of the series 😍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 25, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Superb start to this trilogy. Another wonderful romantic fantasy book. Could not put this down and loved the two main characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Just love this authors style of writing, she draws me into the characters. Just love the Assassin, he is a bad boy you just have to love.
